channel.title: Anyway possible to connect to mopar's irc without using port 6667?
channel.description:
My ISP has 6667 blocked. Anyway I can connect to mopar's irc without using port 6667?
Thanks.. I'd really like to join. Especially since dylock is back and will probably be joining. I'd love to chat with him, haven't seen him in ages.

item.title: Anyway possible to connect to mopar's irc without using port 6667?
item.dc:creator: @j4m3s j4m3s
item.description:
@j4m3s wrote:

its hosted on 6667, therefore you need to use 6667

Read full topic
item.source: Anyway possible to connect to mopar's irc without using port 6667?

item.title: Anyway possible to connect to mopar's irc without using port 6667?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

BobDole81:

That’s weird…well the only way I know of is to use a proxy, but chances are efak is already set up to block/ban users using proxies : Unless you make your own.

Yeah I tried some proxies but none of them were able to connect.

And if I was to make my own, well then I’d be using my own connection anyways However I do have my own web based proxy, but it is also unable to connect using webclients.[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 06:56:40 PM[/size][hr]I found out that you can connect using irc.moparisthebest.com:8080, or whatever port number you want. However, it still doesn’t work.

Does anyone at all have any other ideas?

Read full topic

item.source: Anyway possible to connect to mopar's irc without using port 6667?

item.title: Anyway possible to connect to mopar's irc without using port 6667?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

xerozcheez:

Nah I don’t think there’s no other way, it’s hosted on 6667 therefore you can’t connect using another port, try contacting your isp.

I’ll try that…

Long ago they blocked 6667 for no reason. I phoned them and they didn’t even know what I was talking about. Damn call centers… Then since I’m not very agressive I got my parents to phone and talk to the supervisors and crap and they said it was for the security of it’s users. Then they unblocked the port a few months later and I was happy. Just lately they blocked it again.

Strange thing is that everyone else with my ISP who doesn’t live in the Ottawa region doesn’t have 6667 blocked. Seems that it’s only blocked in my area -.-

Read full topic
